explanation: The report is not correct. Although metal_io_block_write only reads io->size and io->ops in the local code path, the function passes io to other functions (metal_io_virt and io->ops.block_write). Those operations are part of the I/O API and almost certainly expect a non-const struct metal_io_region * (and block_write may legitimately modify the region or at least is declared to take a non-const pointer). Making io a pointer-to-const would therefore be incompatible with those calls unless those callee signatures were also changed. In short, you cannot safely qualify io as const here because it is forwarded to functions that take a non-const pointer; therefore the agent A's claim that this violates MISRA C:2023 Rule 8.13 is not correct in this context.
